Type.Name: IndexOutOfRangeException

TypeSignature.Value: .class public sealed serializable IndexOutOfRangeException extends System.SystemException

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents the error that occurs when an attempt is made to access an element of an array with an index that is outside the bounds of the array.

example.para: The following example demonstrates an error that causes a exception.
example.code: array[0] = 0 array[1] = 0 array[2] = 0 Error: System.IndexOutOfRangeException: Index was outside the bounds of the array. at IndexRangeTest.Main()

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "An array index is out of range." This message takes into account the current system culture.

MemberSignature.Value: public rtspecialname specialname instance void .ctor(string message)

Docs.param: A that describes the error. The content of is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance using . If is , the property is initialized to the system-supplied message provided by the constructor that takes no arguments. The property is initialized to .
